title: The Social Fiction

panel_structure.description: Airport scene with travelers wearing literal masks of their curated selves—professional smiles, vacation personas, business identities—all performing for invisible audiences
Dinner party where guests' true selves float above as ghosts while their bodies perform social scripts, phones showing different curated versions for different platforms

transformation_notes: Social spaces become stages where 'who I am' is revealed as elaborate performance art—necessary fictions we maintain to navigate human interaction while our 'what' remains hidden.
